intro: Ageratina pseudochilca, commonly known as silverleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves with a velvety texture, and its small, white or pale blue flowers bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. Ageratina pseudochilca thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight.
